Pavankumar Tallapragada
Room 422, IDR building (Tata SmartX Hub)
Robert Bosch Centre for Cyber Physical Systems
Indian Institute of Science
Bengaluru - 560012, India

I am an Associate Professor in the Robert Bosch Centre for Cyber Physical Systems at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru, India. I joined IISc as an Assistant Professor in 2017. Before joining IISc, I was a postdoc at University of California, San Diego. I obtained my PhD at the University of Maryland, College Park.

My research interests include networked control systems, event-triggered control, distributed systems and control, multi-agent systems. Some of the applications I am interested in are cyber physical systems, multi-robot control and planning, networked transportation systems, dynamics of social networks and social systems.

Google Scholar LinkedIn

  • (Sept 2025) Our paper titled “Event-Triggered Polynomial Model Predictive Control for Multi-Agent Navigation” has been accepted for presentation at the Indian Control Conference (ICC) 2025.

  • (July 2025) Our paper titled “Multi-Topic Projected Opinion Dynamics for Resource Allocation” has been accepted for presentation in IEEE Conference on Decision and Control (CDC) 2025.

  • (July 2025) Our TCNS paper titled “Opinion Dynamics for Utility Maximizing Agents: Exploring the Impact of the Resource Penalty” has been accepted for presentation in IEEE Conference on Decision and Control (CDC) 2025.

  • (July 2025) Our paper titled “A Control Lyapunov Function Approach to Event-Triggered Parameterized Control for Discrete-Time Linear Systems” has been accepted for publication in European Journal of Control (EJC). This was originally a paper that we submitted to ECC 2025. We were invited to submit the same work to EJC, which has now been accepted for publication.

  • (Apr 2025) Our paper titled “Event-Triggered Polynomial Control for Trajectory Tracking by Unicycle Robots” has been accepted for presentation in the IEEE International Conference on Control & Automation (ICCA).
